metadata.title: CVE-2023-40889 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap-based buffer overflow exists in the qr_reader_match_centers functionof ZBar 0.23.90. Specially crafted QR codes may lead to informationdisclosure and/or arbitrary code execution. To trigger this vulnerability,an attacker can digitally input the malicious QR code, or prepare it to bephysically scanned by the vulnerable scanner.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40889` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libbarcode-zbar-perl - 0.23.92-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
libzbar0 - 0.23.92-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
libzbargtk0 - 0.23.92-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
libzbarqt0 - 0.23.92-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
python3-zbar - 0.23.92-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
zbar-tools - 0.23.92-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
zbarcam-gtk - 0.23.92-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
zbarcam-qt - 0.23.92-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: zbar package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.23.92-4ubuntu0.1~esm1').
